newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugo, Greece reach accord avoiding double taxes.
newsitem.headline: Yugo, Greece reach accord avoiding double taxes.

text.p: Yugoslavia and Greece initialed on Wednesday an agreement to avoid double taxation, Tanjug news agency quoted the Yugoslav information ministry as saying.

"The agreement represents a substantial contribution to the promotion of economic and financial cooperation between Yugoslavia and Greece because it removes the problem of double taxation," the ministry said in a statement.

The accord was initialed in Belgrade by Yugoslav Deputy Finance Minister Miodrag Bulajic and head of the tax department in the Greek Finance Ministry Vrisis Vinieri. -- Beti Bilandzic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 222 4305
